content: You should not have your profile in a dropbox folder.
creator: wsmwk

content: When first setting up an account, Thunderbird offers either POP or IMAP. If that isn't correct, just change it prior to filling in the rest of account information. If you're sure all the information is correct, omit the password during setup, as that at least allows Thunderbird to validate the proper connections to servers.
creator: davidsk

content: Your complaint is not ignored, but the financial/legal folks say this is necessary. Thank you for your donation. You're one of the minority that helps keep Thunderbird available to everyone.
creator: davidsk

content:
from the FAQ on https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/#faq

Why do you need my address in order to process a gift? We understand that your privacy is very important. We ask for a minimum amount of information required to process credit card payments, including billing addresses. This allows our payment processor to verify your identity, process your payment, and prevent fraudulent charges to your credit card. We keep your information private — if you have questions, please refer to our Privacy Policy. If you would rather not fill in your information on our online form, you can mail us a cheque.
creator: James

content: I am not familiar with mail.ru, but I do suggest you review your settings for any inconsistencies. This URL may be helpful. https://clean.email/blog/email-settings/mail-ru-email-settings

content: For anyone reading this, I have finally resolved the issue. Rather than clicking on the hamburger icon, whilst highlighting the appropriate inbox, click on view/sort by/ and changed threaded to unthreaded. I still don't understand why Tbird randomly changed the settings, which I have had for years, but at least at the moment, it is undoable!
creator: sminns

content: Try this: - click 'new message' icon' - click view>toolbar and tick the composition toolbar if view option is not viewable, click alt key to display menu bar first
creator: davidsk

content: Da quel che so, si può fare con qualsiasi carta di credito o tramite Paypal. Basta andare in questa pagina -> https://www.thunderbird.net/it/donate/ scegliere l'importo da donare e fare click su Dona e sostieni. Nella finestra successiva si possono scegliere vari metodi di pagamento tra cui anche la carta di credito.

content: Could you post a screenshot? I've never seen it missing. However, if you rightclick on unified toolbar, I think you can add a 'write' button to it.
creator: davidsk

content: This can sometimes happen if TB is interrupted by such as an antivirus program. This may work: - exit TB' - in File Explorer, rename the original to something else (just to ensure it isn't lost) - remove the -2 from the other and restart TB - if all is okay, you can delete item you renamed
creator: davidsk

content: To stop the autofilling, click settings>composition and UNtick the box to 'automatically add outgoing email addresses'
creator: davidsk

content: I normally suggest starting with https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems however JAWS complicates the investigation somewhat. You might try asking at https://groups.io/g/thunderbird/ which specializes in accessibility.

content: I wasn't aware that Thunderbird for Android had been released yet. Generally speaking, your Android email app should use the same settings as you use on your laptop.
creator: davidsk

content:
This is sometimes problematic, but should normally work: Exit Thunderbird if running. 

   click windows key and 'r' key    Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade    click on 'OK'

Personally, I do not recommend it, as the prior version will no longer be supported and you will eventually need to upgrade for continued support.
creator: davidsk

content:
I opened the "About Profiles" link on the "Troubleshooting Information" in Thunderbird. This is what it shows:


About Profiles This page helps you to manage your profiles. Each profile is a separate world which contains separate history, bookmarks, settings and add-ons. Restart Profile: default-release This is the profile in use and it cannot be deleted. Default Profile yes Root Directory C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ftywnrod.default-release Local Directory C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\ftywnrod.default-release Profile: default Default Profile no Root Directory C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\43w0wqaa.default Local Directory C:\Users\Dell\AppData\Local\Thunderbird\Profiles\43w0wqaa.default

At the end of each Directory entry there is an "Open Folder" button and below the "Profile: default-release" profile there is a "Rename" button. Below the "Profile: default" profile there are "Rename", Remove", "Set as default profile" and "Launch profile" buttons.

Is there anything I need to do on this page to retrieve the Local Folder sub folders?

Joe
creator: joseph-rowland
